result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Renaldo Dagon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2*: Fine is set at ZERO. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. 
Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $10.00 total ($5.00 for each count) per month with the first payment due on 12-01-2015 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter. If there are any missed payments, any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.
Concurrent with: to Count 2 and consecutive to any other sentence; straight time. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Concurrent with: to Count 1 and consecutive to any sentence, straight time with credit for 49 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

*Drivers license suspension is NOT imposed*

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 49 DAYS in the House of Correction concurrent with count 2 of 15CF1907, and consecutive to any sentence; straight time; 49 days credit. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 
AS TO COUNT 2: 
Court ordered defendant to serve 49 DAYS in the House of Correction concurrent with count 1 of 15CF1907, and consecutive to any sentence; straight time 49 days credit. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2:

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Court ordered defendant to all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges,  including the DNA surcharge  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $10.00 total ($5.00 for each count) per month with the first payment due on 12-01-2015 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.  


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Sean Renaldo Dagon in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea hearing.
AS TO COUNT 2:

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(3g)(e) , a Misdemeanor. 

AS TO COUNT 1 & AMENDED COUNT2 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.
From Atty Krause on behalf of the defendant, stating the defendant will be entering a plea on 10/12/15. Received and filed.

Defendant Sean Renaldo Dagon in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Case set for Motion hearing and final pretrial. Defense counsel notified Court defense motion was previously filed and decided on by Judge Pocan. Case proceeded to final pretrial.   

Final pretrial held. Case remains in a jury trial posture. Court will allow, if parties negotiate a resolution, to submit written notice of change of plea and should be filed no later than 10-05-2015 at 12:00 pm, in branch 17.  Parties to have any written stipulations of fact shall be submitted to the court no later than 10-12-2015 at 9:00 am. Jury trial remains scheduled for 10-12-2015 at 9:00 am, Branch 17. Case adjourned for jury trial, branch 17.

From ADA Wigley received and filed. tk

Defendant Sean Renaldo Dagon in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Any motions due no later than 7-24-2015 by 5:00 pm. Response due no later than 8-21-2015 by 5:00 pm. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 09-22-2015 at 1:30 pm, and Jury Trial scheduled on 10-12-2015 at 9:00 am, Branch 17.   Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Calendar call scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 05:00 pm.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing MAY 26, 2015, received and filed. (13 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  ATTY BRIDGET KRAUSE, 819 N. 6TH STREET, 9TH FLOOR, MILWAUKEE, WI  53203

Defendant Sean Renaldo Dagon in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Zachary Wittchow for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #05CM9207 that are attached to the complaint.Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Department Officer Raynaldo Roman.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17. Court approved an extension of the scheduling date for reasons stated on the record.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sean Renaldo Dagon in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-18-2015 at 1:30pm
